sn11.8:1.2: Now at that time the Buddha had gone into retreat for the day’s meditation.
sn11.8:1.3: Then Sakka, lord of gods, and Verocana, lord of titans, approached the Buddha and stationed themselves one by each door-post.
sn11.8:1.4: Then Verocana spoke this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn11.8:2.3: A goal is splendid when accomplished—
sn11.8:2.4: this is the word of Verocana!”
sn11.8:3.3: For the goal that’s splendid when accomplished,
sn11.8:3.4: naught better than patience is found.”
sn11.8:4.2: as they deserve in each case.
sn11.8:4.3: But even so, harnessed work is the highest
sn11.8:4.4: thing of value for all living creatures.
sn11.8:4.5: A goal is splendid when accomplished—
sn11.8:4.6: this is the word of Verocana!”
sn11.8:5.2: as they deserve in each case.
sn11.8:5.3: But rather than harnessed work being the highest
sn11.8:5.4: thing of value for all living creatures,
sn11.8:5.5: for the goal that’s splendid when accomplished,
